lines.text:
[voice-over]
When I was small my mother was everything to me. I thought she was beautiful, and I wanted to be like her. I used to try and smile, walk and talk just like her; I even practiced laughing like she did. My mother loved flowers, and her favourite flowers were roses. And so she called my sister Rose. And she called me Iris.
Yeah, I'm fine. Are you sure you're okay?

[voice-over]
Maybe I'll have a go at the singing, or maybe I'll work in a flower shop. This woman, she'd got an ad in the paper. Lots of people applied for the job, but she's chosen me. I've always loved flowers. I love their smell, their colours, the shapes they make. I could learn all their names by heart.
